    Used to describe a instruction step maneuver.

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        A specific string describing the type of maneuver. The following types are currently used: continue, bear right, turn right, sharp right, u-turn, sharp left, turn left, bear left, waypoint, depart, enter roundabout, and arrive. Warning, new maneuver types may be introduced in the future however, so check here to ensure you don't miss any.
        Returns:
        string with possibly one of the maneuvers given above.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setType

        public void setType(java.lang.String type)
        Parameters:
        type - string with possibly one of the maneuvers given above.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getLocation

        public ManeuverPoint getLocation()
        ManeuverPoint object containing type and the coordinate.
        Returns:
        ManeuverPoint object.
        Since:
        1.0.0

        Parameters:
        location - ManeuverPoint object.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getInstruction

        public java.lang.String getInstruction()
        Human-readable string describing the maneuver. typically combines getType() and a street name. if within MapboxDirections.Builder you setInstructions to HTML, you'll relieve the instructions in HTML format.
        Returns:
        string typically the length of a sentence giving next maneuver instruction.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setInstruction

        public void setInstruction(java.lang.String instruction)
        Parameters:
        instruction - string typically the length of a sentence giving next maneuver instruction.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getMode

        public java.lang.String getMode()
        A string signifying the mode of transportation. Possible values can be:

        For driving: driving, ferry, movable bridge, unaccessible.

        For walking: walking, ferry, unaccessible.

        For cycling: cycling, walking, ferry, train, movable bridge, unaccessible.

        Returns:
        string with possibly one of the values given above.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setMode

        public void setMode(java.lang.String mode)
        Parameters:
        mode - string with possibly one of the values given above.
        Since:
        1.0.0
